fields.description:
When I open a certain repository on a master branch it always crashes.
Attached are the .log and and .dmp files.
fields.summary: Some repositories crach insource tree

fields.description: Stash dialog doesn't close when you click OK, it does the work, but it stays on the screen. The only way to close it is with Cancel, however that doesn't cancel the stashing that is already finished.
fields.summary: Stash dialog doesn't close when OK is clicked

fields.description:
I just discovered that after updating SourceTree, you get prompted again to set up the clone URL browser integration. It turns out that ClickOnce subtly changes the install location of the exe after every update, for example, these are the paths for 2 versions, minor version updates between:
{noformat}
C:\Users\Steve\AppData\Local\Apps\2.0\L18119EM.AJK\EPVB32CT.29C\sour..tion_81acde56111400aa_0000.0008_f8d95343db04f95f\SourceTree.exe
C:\Users\Steve\AppData\Local\Apps\2.0\L18119EM.AJK\EPVB32CT.29C\sour..tion_81acde56111400aa_0000.0008_f9d772bad68d6b9f\SourceTree.exe
{noformat}
I guess some hash of the version number gets appended to install directory. 

This means that after update SourceTree *correctly* detects that the URL handlers are not pointing to the correct place and offers to fix it. However from a user's perspective this is annoying.

Maybe we could use a shortcut in a stable location which we can always update (like in the settings area) so that the registry doesn't have to be changed every update, only the shortcut.
fields.summary: SourceTree prompts to set up URL handlers after every update

fields.description:
When SourceTree can't locate a Git install, a menu pops up allowing you to choose from 3 ways to deal with it. And that menu has a spelling mistake. It's supposed to say "We were not able to locate a Git install on your system. There are 3 ways we can deal with this." 

For your guys' reference, I attached a screenshot of the spelling error.
fields.summary: Spelling error when SourceTree can't locate a Git install.
Add possibility change toolbars icon sizes, and add/delete icons in toolbar, hide toolbar

fields.description:
When opening application, was prompted to update to v0.8.4.

On the first attempt, an error was raised (details not captured, sorry) - stated something around a component not working properly and gave error with an HRESULT value.

Application appeared stable after this.

Used "Help" menu to check for updates. Clicked updated, application appeared to attempt download and then crashed.

Requested log files attached.
fields.summary: Crash when updating SourceTree to v0.8.4

fields.description: At the moment terminal window opens in Projects folder (the one set in settings). I feel like it should open in current repository's (currently opened tab) directory instead.
fields.summary: Terminal window should (have an option to) open in current working directory

fields.description:
At the moment when doing any operation that requires showing the progress window (with optional git output area - example attached) once the progress window appears there's no way to close it with just keyboard. There's no focus set anywhere.
What's worse, there Close button is not selectable when tabbing through focusable and clickable items.

It'd be great if the focus was automatically set to the close button on success.
fields.summary: Progress/Output window focus on completion

fields.description: I have a repository with about 27,000 commits, and when paging through them, source tree crashed after going through a few hundred in the branch view.
fields.summary: sourcetree crashes when looking at history of large repository

fields.description: When going into the Commit window as an example, focus is automatically given to the message field. When you go into the add remote popup, however, no fields have focus. Could focus be put into the first field, the remote name?
fields.summary: Give focus to name in Add Remote Popup

fields.description: Scrolling in the log view is slow because the details update for every row. Consider updating the details only after pausing on a row.
fields.summary: Log scrolling is slow

fields.description:
Height of controls (specifically buttons and edits) is smaller than other Windows application have. This makes application harder to use and it looks rather strange. 

Problem is mostly visible on Windows 8, but on Windows 7 buttons are also too small, while edits are normal size.

I have attached two partial screen snapshots, above red line is what I would expect controls to look like. Snapshots are created with 0.8.2 version, but problem persists on 0.8.3
fields.summary: Buttons and edits have smaller height than usual on Windows 8

fields.description:
On 0.8.2:
1) After being asked to update, i confirmed
2) No progress on the bar was visible so i pressed "cancel"
3) After adding some files to the git index, i pressed the "commit" button on the toolbar
4) Shortly after starting to write the commit message Sourcetree crashed

After restarting SourceTree it's at version 0.8.3
fields.summary: Crash on canceled update (or commit)

fields.description: When I'm in a console window (console has focus), and I perform "git checkout existing-branch", I would like SourceTree to switch to the branch in the background, rather than waiting until it has focus.
fields.summary: Update branch from console

fields.description:
when inspecting an uncommited removed file SourceTree get's extremely slow and the ui is not responding for a minute when the file is a little bit bigger...

please inspect this issue
fields.summary: working with removed files is extremely slow

fields.description:
I keep the SourceTree app open all day on my secondary monitor. 

When I launch it now, it opens maximized on my secondary monitor. When I minimize it (starting maximized) from the secondary monitor and restore it again, it always appears on the primary monitor.

If I restore it down (not minimized) and restore it back to maximized, this problem goes away.
fields.summary: Minimizing the SourceTree app from a secondary monitor and restoring it doesn't appear back in the original window

fields.description: I was attempting to upgrade from 0.8.2b to 0.8.3b using the check for updates feature and the application crashed
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes when trying to update

fields.description:
Is it possible to keep the well known icon-set?
Because i use mac and windows to develop, so the design / icons with the "old" set is more familar to me.

Maybe you can give the user the choice, what kind of iconset he want to use for the interface.
fields.summary: New iconset

fields.description:
Since Windows 8 and variants provide a spell check API, it would be trivial to add this feature in the commit message dialog. 

Since some people may not like the feature enabled all the time -- include an option to disable and re-enable the spell check feature at will.
fields.summary: Optionally Use built in SpellCheck API if on Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012

fields.description:
Get the attached error dialog 3 time when I try to do a Tools > Launch SSH Agent (Pageant).

Note, I seem to have 2 copies of it on my Windows 7 PC:
C:\>where pageant
c:\Program Files (x86)\putty\pageant.exe
C:\Program Files\TortoiseHg\Pageant.exe

I need SSH to clone a repository.  Where can I find out more info on how to do this with SourceTree?

Olaf
fields.summary: Lauch SSH Agent fails

fields.description:
Trying to clone the repo from ssh://hg@dev..... (works on mac), says "This is not a valid source path / URL".
Launch pageant from SourceTree and try to open the key, give me and error: "Could not load this key (unable to open file)".
Right click on pageant in the bottom right, add key, key adds successfully.
Still cannot check out the repository from SSH.
fields.summary: Cannot clone a repository from ssh

fields.description:
When selecting to ignore a file, I'd like to see an option to add it to a .gitignore file in that current directory, rather than at the repository root. 

This feature is supported by TortoiseGit via the ".gitignore in the containing directories of the items" option. 

It is helpful when working with multiple project templates within a repo that can then reuse the .gitignore file, and for avoiding clutter and segregating changes from the top-level .gitignore. 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Support option for creating .gitignore in containing directories of ignored items

fields.description:
I'd like to see the option to ignore a file locally (via ./git/info/exclude) rather than via a .gitignore. 

TortoiseGit supports this via the Ignore menu option "./git/info/exclude". 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Support adding a file/path to ./git/info/exclude via the Ignore menu

fields.description:
To reproduce: 

1) Create an untracked file within several nested folders in repo. 
2) In the File Status -> Working Copy view of the repo:
 - Right click the file in the Working Copy Changes pane
 - Select Ignore...
 - Select the "Ignore everything beneath:" radio button. 
 - Click the drop down box to select the directory.
 - Observe any options after the second have invalid path delimiters.

Selecting any of these options will put a non-functional statement in the .gitignore file. 

See screenshot for example.
fields.summary: "Ignore Everything beneath:" presents invalid options

fields.description: Happened during the installation.  See attached picture.
fields.summary: Installation Problem

fields.description: in the list of the jump-to feature of git log view are all branches,tags,... listed several times
fields.summary: Reopen: SRCTREEWIN-156 - git log - Jump to-feature - duplicate entries

fields.description:
When I have some files in my Staged Changes and some normal changes I clicked Commit.
The PopUp showed up with two seperate boxes (for staged changes and working copy changes)

then I selected "Commit Mode: Selected Files"
now only one Box appears, with the files of "working copy changes"

When I check these files and commit, boah!, also the files from "staged changes" have been commited!
fields.summary: Reopen: Commit - Selected Files includes files in stash not checked

fields.description:
Multiple newlines in commit messages seem to be collapsed when displayed anywhere in SourceTree, e.g. commit details or amend last commit message edit field.

They do seem to be saved in commits correctly, though.
fields.summary: Commit message newlines are collapsed for display.
Crash on Reset a deleted file into diferent commit state

fields.description: We routinely have more than one Git repository per project. It would be quite handy to save the all open repositories as "workspace" to a file to make opening multiple related repos more efficient.
fields.summary: Ability to save open repositories as a "Workspace"

fields.description:
It appears some people behind proxy servers (particularly with NTLM auth) get errors when trying to download the embedded Git.

Investigate how to support proxy setups in the download window.
fields.summary: Support proxy servers when downloading Git

fields.description:
Current Behavior: Opening a file the 'Working Copy Changes' window by double clicking on it and then clicking 'No' in the User Account Control window (Instead of yes) causes Source Tree to Crash

Expected Behavior: Clicking 'No' in the User Account Control window should not cause source tree to crash.

Steps
1) Open the 'Working Copy Changes' window
2) Double click on a File
3) In the User Account Control window (Default program for opening file requires Admin) click 'No'
fields.summary: Attempting to open a source file and then canceling the User Account Control menu causes Source Tree to crash

fields.description: When I use Ctrl+A in Staged Changes Panel, I can not deselect items anymore. There is a workaround. Select another commit in upper panel, and then again Uncommitted changes.
fields.summary: Staged changes panel selection

fields.description: The ctrl+d shortcut to open the external diff tool is not working in the commit window.
fields.summary: Ctrl + D (external diff) is not working in commit window

fields.description: When adding a git repo with an https origin that requires a password, I was being prompted but it took me a while to realize that the prompt popup was in fact under the other windows.
fields.summary: Password dialog pops up behind other windows

fields.description:
There's a lot of assumed knowledge around the SSH configuration at the moment. I've not previously had any putty stuff configured, having used only gitbash and associated openssh config, and this is the key I have on bitbucket. 

It took me a bit of fiddling to work out what I needed to do in the "Tools > Launch SSH Agent" and "Tools > Create or Import SSH Keys" dialogs before things would work (and I'm currently stuck with SRCTREEWIN-281 as a result).

If SRCTREEWIN-248 won't get done, then I think automation or guidance in this process would be useful.
fields.summary: Wizard or Auto-Setup of Putty Keys based on the OpenSSH keys already configured

fields.description: When a big file (3000 lines in this case) exists in the working copy or index clicking on it hangs the GUI for a few seconds as it is reading the file and formatting it.
fields.summary: Don't read big files completely on click
Working Copy Changes pane can be rather slow

fields.description: The currently selected branch is not highlighted, I really can't understand how to figure out what branch I am in right now. I think current branch is highlighted with bold title
fields.summary: Current branch is not highlighted

fields.description: The toolbar doesn't appear entirely on SourceTree with Windows 8. A screenshot of the problem is attached.
fields.summary: Toolbar disappears on Windows 8

fields.description:
I cant see anywhere in source tree that will allow me to connect to my github or BB account so I can list all of my repos. I want to be able to clone directly from the app - not log into BB first, then fined the link then clone. Same should go for github.

I see this feature as a must - github for windows already has a similar feature.
fields.summary: Connect to BB and List Repos

fields.description:
Following steps:
1. The first file in the files view is selected (in my case, it is .gitignore file in NugetGallery source code)
2. Click on Up or down arrow on vertical scroll bar more than once
3. .gitignore file is getting opened.
fields.summary: Files View: Clicking on Vertical Scrollbar up/down button causes file to open

fields.description: crashes and then crashes on every open until the repository is deleted from the HDD
fields.summary: crash when opening an On Disk Project from IBM Notes Designer aka Lotus Notes

fields.description:
When I first ran Sourcetree for Windows, I pointed it to my private ssh key (id_pub) and I think it really wanted the putty format ppk key. Anyhow, now I can't repick it. If I go to Tools, Launch SSH Agent(Pageant), a popup titled "Pageant" says "Couldn't load this key (OpenSSH SSH-2 private key)". And that's all I can do. If I try to clone a repo over ssh, I get put back in the Pageant error popup.
I found the folder Windows installed the app in, and there doesn't appear to be a local config file I can edit/remove and relaunch Sourcetree so I can re-do my ssh key. How do I get this "bad" key out so I can use ssh with Sourcetree?
fields.summary: Can't re-pick my ssh key

fields.description:
Adding many files does not work. See the video what happens.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GQIaWAww954
fields.summary: Adding Many files to index does not work

fields.description: When committing files, it would be nice to be able to scroll the file list horizontally instead of having to re-size the panels.
fields.summary: add horizontal scroll bar on working copy changes window.

fields.description: If you could provide the ability to create custom actions that would be swell.  I would then be able to implement Git Flow without you having to worry about implementing Git Flow yet (like you have on the Mac version).  I <3 Git Flow.
fields.summary: Implement custom actions

fields.description:
When creating a new get repo on an existing folder with lots of files it is very difficult to make a clean commit by selecting subsets of the files. 

It would be convenient if you could filter the list. 

For example, I have a folder with 680 table scripts. I would like to commit them per functional domain, but there is no way to filter out "user" tables for example. 

Replicating the "Search" box on the Staged changes on the working copy changes list would be a good solution also.
fields.summary: Filter "Working Copy Changes"

fields.description:
SourceTree crashed when I was trying to edit repository-specific ignore list. 
That's what I did: 

- Click on Settings in the upper right corner
- Click on the Advanced tab
- Click on the Edit button
fields.summary: Crash while trying to edit repository-specific ignore list

fields.description: When using a repository that is located on an remote fileshare, clicking the Terminal button will not open the repositories' path. The Terminal opens on the home directory instead.
fields.summary: Terminal Button and repositories on file shares

fields.description: When double clicking on a .dll file in the Working Copy Changes.
fields.summary: Crash on double click on .dll file in the Working Copy Changes

fields.description: Add possibility of export the changed files in selected commit, as does TortoiseGit or TortoiseSVN
fields.summary: Support to export the changed files
Commit message spell checking

fields.description: When committing, if you right click a file and select discard, the confirm discard dialog never appears and the file doesn't get discarded. Discarding from the file status tab in the main view works however.
fields.summary: Discarding changes from commit dialog doesn't work

fields.description:
When I have Sourcetree set to open maximised on my secondary display (from initially starting the app), minimising it (to the task bar) and then maximising it again later restores it on the primary display instead. If I drag it back (whilst maximised still) to the secondary display again, it will continue this behaviour each time it's minimised.

To get out of the loop, I can either:
- Ensure I always initially start the app on my primary display (when maximised); I can then drag it to my secondary display and it will behave correctly from there on (min/max to primary)

- If I "restore down" (middle button between minimise and close) and then maximise it again on secondary, it seems to sort itself out and behave correctly.
fields.summary: Dual monitor unminimises to wrong monitor

fields.description: Not very clear the reason of crashing. I was moving from local repo to remote repo in Bitbucket and at some point when I was selecting  the changes with pressed Shift and the mouse the application gave me an error msg. I am forwarding the files related to the point my PC crashed.
fields.summary: Crashing while I was selecting changes

fields.description:
Background: When I do a git commit --amend from the command line if my commit message starts with a # then I have to insert a space just for the commit to go through. This is causing the commit messages to appear staggered on the screen.

It would be nice if that space was trimmed out prior to rendering it on screen to keep the messages list on line with each other.
fields.summary: Trim whitespace from commit message

fields.description: As it says in the title, if you right click and bring up the context menu in the staged changes pane, it says 'Copy Path To Clipboad'.
fields.summary: Typo in context menu 'Copy Path To Clipboad'

fields.description: I right clicked a branch and selected Push to origin, and Source Tree crashed. I've attached the dump file.
fields.summary: Crash while pushing a local branch to origin

fields.description: I was attempting to select three bookmarks so that I could drag them into a subfolder in the bookmark menu when the application crashed.
fields.summary: Crashed while trying to select multiple bookmarks to move

fields.description:
After installation, in windows start button menu, there is a Atlassian/"SourceTree online support" link file which goes to https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/support

However if I go there I got:
 - chrome telling me it's not safe (ok let's say I continue)
 - this error:
"Not Found

The requested URL /support was not found on this server.

Additionally, a 404 Not Found error was encountered while trying to use an ErrorDocument to handle the request."
fields.summary: Help link in windows menu is wrong(?)

fields.description:
Set the option "Check submodules before commit & push" to off.

Then checkout to an arbitrary local branch
While checking out, click on "Show full output".
The output I see is

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false checkout master
M	src/BunnyTail/BunnyTail.csproj
M	src/BunnyTail/Program.cs
M	src/BunnyTail/packages.config


Already on 'master'


git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false submodule update --init --recursive
Completed successfully.



That is, a git submodule update is performed.
Is it correct?
fields.summary: Submodules are updated even if "Check submodules before commit & push" option is off

fields.description:
The repository I'm using is : http://github.com/artofsequence/aos-all/

I can't pull changes from sub-module from SourceTree but I did it repo by repo using tortoisegit. 
Then I switch to sourcetree and I can see the changes in this repository which basically are just change of sub-repo versions.
However, if I commit, it commits deleting the sub-module directories.

I didn't find a way to fix this. (had to reset my version)

Notice that if I commit the same change in tortoisegit, I correctly got just changes on submodule verions when I look at it in SourceTree.
fields.summary: Committing sub-repos version change will delete them

fields.description: When I closed Pageant it didn't store the ssh key and when I went to commit and push to the repository it failed so I had to re add the key.
fields.summary: SSH key not storing

fields.description: Logged on to my PC this morning to find that SourceTreeApp had crashed, so no idea what caused it.  Attaching log files though.
fields.summary: Crash - no further info
When I click "Check for updates" I get crashed

fields.description: Tabs overlap text in footer when screen is small
fields.summary: Overlapping text in footer when window is small

fields.description: I staged some files to commit, scrolled down through the list of unstaged (and untracked) files, clicked the Terminal button to open a console, and then clicked to another application. When I clicked back to put SourceTree in focus it had crashed.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed

fields.description: I had tried to refresh the master branch area, but then just decided to close down.
fields.summary: Shutting down after hitting refresh caused crash

fields.description:
This may exist but I couldn't find it.

If a repo has been modified by someone and your computer is out of date, have some sort of icon or colour change to represent there is a more up to date version of the git repo that needs syncing or pulling.
fields.summary: Indication that a repo needs syncing/pulling

fields.description: When you first set up SourceTree it offers to download a private git binary if one isn't installed / can't be found. However, it looks like the request isn't routed through any configured http proxies, so the download fails if http proxies are required to get to the internet.
fields.summary: when setting up sourcetree, git download attempt doesn't use system proxy and fails

fields.description:
If i open the setup wizzard "File" > "Setup Wizzard ...", i cannot close the wizzard screen by using the windows close button.

I only can "Skip setup" or go to the next screen and press finish.
fields.summary: Close Button not works in Setup Wizzard

fields.description: If you have two stashes with the same name in separate repositories that are open in tabs, the stash will sometimes try to apply to the wrong repo
fields.summary: Stash applied to wrong repo

fields.description: I already use git, and I already have it set up globally with an OpenSSH key (%HOME%\.ssh\id_rsa).  It'd be much more convenient if SourceTree could use this key as-is, rather than forcing me to convert it to PuTTY format first.
fields.summary: Add support for OpenSSH keys in addition to PuTTY keys

fields.description:
I have already been using git on my windows machine and I have everything configured through my Home directory. By this I mean that I have:

- SSH Keys
- Global .gitconfig
- Global .gitignore

It would be nice to install SourceTree and have it just utilize what I already have configured instead of needing me to import my keys, and impose a different global .gitignore.
fields.summary: Utilize existing git settings in %HOME% directory

fields.description: When switching from the file status view to branch view the app suddenly crashed.
fields.summary: sourcetree crashes when viewing branch view of repository

fields.description:
When I launched SourceTree on my Windows 7 64-bit OS, everything loaded fine but the icons below the menu bar did not load. 

Its definitely not my machine resources.. my windows 7 machine is a beast, with i7 CPU and 8GB RAM.

Pls. find the attached screen shot.
fields.summary: The icons below the menu bar are not loading properly

fields.description:
I cant push to bitbucket.
Pageant is running, working keyfile is imported.


*UPDATE*
Its working now. I deleted my "Default Settings" entry in PuTTY.
Here is a .reg-file that fixes the problem: [RemovePuttyDefaultSettings.reg|https://dl.dropbox.com/u/1992068/Share/2013/03/RemovePuttyDefaultSettings.reg]
Just download and run.
fields.summary: Cant push to remote - Git not using the keyfile from Pageant

fields.description: In the options dialog under the Git tab, the Push branches drop-down does not include the "simple" option which was introduced in Git 1.8 and will be the default starting in 2.0.
fields.summary: Add 'simple' option to Git push branches setting (Git 1.8.1+)

fields.description: I imported the wrong putty keys at the first time. Now, every time i want to launch pageant, it raise an error "couldn't load this key (not a private key)".
fields.summary: When Launch SSH using Pageant, Source Tree automatically import only the first time private key not the last imported

fields.description:
When I create a hook to pre-populate my check in comments it is not picked up by the application. Is there anyway the script output can be picked up? For example I have a template as below which the log must conform to. Once the template is populated the person checking in just removes the brackets and changes the fields as required.

[SCH-0000]

[Comment]
fields.summary: Integrate hook scripts into source tree
Add tool tips for toolbar buttons

fields.description: The SourceTree windows application requires on my system 150Mb memory in Idle state with a small repository loaded. SourceTree requires almost the same amount of memory as Visual Studio 2010. I think it is too much for an application of its size and you should put some effort for better memory management. If we compare it with a similar application like the GitExtensions, The GE loads the same repository with 20Mb and when it is idle releases memory to the minimum.
fields.summary: There is a need of lowering the memory usage of  SourceTree task

fields.description: Might it be possible to create a portable version of SourceTree which will be able to run from the USB Key?
fields.summary: Portable version possible?

fields.description: I have my own Git server with Gitolite installed. As it's known, the right uri to the repository is ssh://user@hostname/repository. SourceTree seems not working with such a structure and gives "This is not valid source path / URI" error. Console GIT takes the same URI without a problem, so, that's not a git configuration problem.
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't accept general ssh:// uri with GitoLite

fields.description:
Possible duplicate of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-113

I'm unable to clone a git repo from Bitbucket using the HTTPS method, as suggested in the FAQ (it's easier than using keys with PuTTY).
The Clone menu claims "This is not a valid source path / URL", despite the exact same path working fine with "git clone $PATH".
fields.summary: Unable to clone Bitbucket Repo via HTTPS

fields.description:
The current ClickOnce based installer does not allow offline installation of SourceTree. This is a problem for us because we use SourceTree on machines on a island network, i.e. one that is not connected to the Internet.
Our web proxies also block direct download of executables for security reasons and so prevent us from downloading the ClickOnce bootstrap.

Please consider moving to an MSI based installer (I can help you out with this if you wish! ;-) ).
fields.summary: Provide offline installer

fields.description:
When the user wishes to open a local repository he can click on File/Open.
A dialog titles "Browse For Folder" is shown.
The dialog allows for file system browsing.
It's not possible to paste or edit a path, which is very annoying.

Please, compare with the same feature for GitExtensions. I attached a screenshot. 

As you can notice, the user *can* paste a path *and* browse for folders.

Since SourceTree mainly targets developers, hence experienced users who love the keyboard, a text box which can be used for pasting or editing a path would be vey appreciated.
fields.summary: Open Repository: can't paste a path

fields.description: The About dialog is just few pixels too small, so the contained text area displays a scrollbar. Yet the vertical scrollbar is useless, since no rows is out of the screen
fields.summary: The About dialog is few pixel too small and displays an useless scrollbar

fields.description:
When ST is launched the first time, the Welcome dialog is shown, in order to ask the user some basic information.
Among the optionsthere's one saying

"Allow SourceTree to modify your global Git and Mercurial config files".

While this option is perfectly legit on Mac OS (and will be legit on the 1.0 Windows version), at the very moment there's no support for Mercurial

Update: The same label appears in Tools/Option/General.
fields.summary: The "Welcome" dialog refers to Mercurial, but Mercurial is yet not supported in this version

fields.description:
Many modern IDEs (ok, this isn't an IDE), provide a context menu accessed by clicking on the tabs.  So....

right clicking on the tab should bring up a context menu to:

*  Open explorer here
*  Open <shell of your choice here>  (e.g. powershell with poshgit)
*  Copy repository path.
*  Other options...
fields.summary: Tabs should have a context menu

fields.description:
If you hover the mouse of the repository tabs it would be nice to see a tooltip showing the path of the repository.

If you hover the mouse over a repository in the left most pane showing repositories, a tooltip here would be nice as well (I've mostly collapsed it, to provide more screen real-estate for the rest of the app).

(see red boxes in attached screen shot).
fields.summary: Add tooltips when hovering over the repositories

fields.description: If you create a folder in the navigation pane and move a repository bookmark inside the folder, if you try to delete the bookmark with the mouse, the application shows the following dialog message (see attachment): "Are you sure you want to remove the following nodes, and all of their children?" instead of the standard "Confirm remove?" dialog box (with the options button "Remove bookmarks", "Delete repository on disk" and "Cancel"). The wrong dialog does not have any of the standard button and clicking OK does not produce any visible effect.
fields.summary: Wrong dialog when trying to remove a repository from the navigation pane if it's inside a folder

fields.description:
The following procedure is repeatable every time.

* Open a repository (in my case a Git repository)
* Select a branch
* Select a commit
* Now press the scrollbar button (up/down) a few times, or press inside the scroll bar itself.
* After a few clicks, the "Confirm change working copy" pops up.

As I do not want to change my working copy, this shouldn't happen.
fields.summary: Dialog "Confirm change working copy" comes up when scrolling history

fields.description: Since I dont want to work with Git, I do not want to excplicitly install git
fields.summary: Unable to skip initial Git setup

fields.description: I just clicked the "download embedded..." button and the app crashed
fields.summary: Crash while downloading embedded Git

fields.description: It requires .NET 4.5, which in turn requires Vista SP2 and up. There's no mention on the blog announcements on either bitbucket or sourcetree.
fields.summary: There's no explicit mention that the software requires Vista SP2 and up.

fields.description:
1. Downloaded setup.exe
2. Installed
3. Restarted computer
4. Tried opening the app

Actual: A webpage opens - http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/SourceTree.application

Expected: The app should be opened
fields.summary: Cannot open application

fields.description: Big buttons with captions took too many space, even in comparision with Office's ribbon
fields.summary: Cleanup UI - Option to make toolbar buttons small and no captions

fields.description: We have a Team Foundation Service Project Collection with Git supported projects. I was unable to push my commits. I kept getting 'failed authentication' messages in the detail window.
fields.summary: Can't push commits to Team Foundation Server.
